com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya

Class AbstractThreadWithException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.AbstractThreadWithException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ReadInputStreamThread, WaitForProcessThread, WriteOutputStreamThread

    @NotFullyTested
public abstract class AbstractThreadWithException
extends Thread
    Extension of class Thread to allow exceptions to be thrown. Instead of run(), subclasses should override runWithException(). Any caught exception can be retrieved with getException() and cleared with clearException().
    Author:
    Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)
    See Also:
    Thread, run(), runWithException(), getException(), clearException()

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractThreadWithException

        public AbstractThreadWithException()

    • Method Detail

      • setException

        protected void setException(Exception exception)
        Sets the exception reference. Normally, there is no need to call this method directly. The method run() catches exceptions throws by runWithException() and sets the exception reference directly. This method exists only for subclasses if they need to control the setting of caught exceptions differently than the standard implementation in this class.
        Parameters:
        exception - reference to a subclass of Exception

      • getException

        public Exception getException()
        Retrieves the caught exception from runWithException(). If this exception is rethrown, it is best to wrap in another exception. Without a wrapper, it may be confusing to catching code the understand the source of the error, as the callstack will not correct show the link between threads.

        After rethrowing the exception, it may be prudent to clear it via clearException(), else the same exception may be rethrown multiple times. However, the option is left to the developer. There may be rare cases where it is necessary or valuable to rethrow the same exception more than once.

        Returns:
        references to exception thrown by runWithException(). May be null
        See Also:
        runWithException(), clearException()

      • clearException

        public void clearException()
        Clears any exception previously thrown by runWithException().
        See Also:
        runWithException(), getException()

      • run

        public void run()
        Calls runWithException() and catches any exception thrown. Subclasses should not override this method; instead override runWithException().
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class Thread
        See Also:
        runWithException(), getException(), clearException()

      • runWithException

        public abstract void runWithException()
                               throws Exception
        Subclasses must override this method, which is called by run(). Implementations are welcome to throw exceptions of type TException.
        Throws:
        Exception - on error
        See Also:
        getException(), clearException()
